article.title: Principles of bursty mRNA expression and irreversibility in single cells and extrinsically varying populations

multiple_choice_question.text: What process is represented by the arrow labeled "e" in the zoomed-in image of the eukaryotic cell nucleus?
What key aspect of cellular heterogeneity is highlighted in the illustration of heterogeneous cells compared to identical cells?
What does the presence of bidirectional arrows in the Markov state diagram indicate about the two-state model?
choices: The system is in thermodynamic equilibrium.

multiple_choice_question.text: What does the formula represent in the context of the two-state gene model?
choices: The steady-state probability of the gene being in the "on" state
The mean burst size of mRNA production
The entropy production rate of mRNA transcription
The free energy difference between the "on" and "off" gene states
